intro: Monnina peruviana, commonly known as Peruvian bluemink, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered with fine hairs, contributing to its drought tolerance. Monnina peruviana is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
